chapter.title: Records
chapter.para: Most of the data defining a record are standardized. However PMB allows the editing of a table originating from a bibliographical record. You can also add customizable fields.

sect1.title: Sources
sect1.para: This represents the source of a bibliographical record. PMB imports records mainly via z39.50 or through UNIMARC import. However these records are copyrighted. Records from the Biblioth√®que Nationale de France [National Library, France] can be used freely, however this might not necessarily be the case for some professionals in this domain. Indeed, the company Electre publishes a CD-Rom of bibliographical records, updated with the latest publications. This CD-Rom is not free, and each one of its bibliographical records are copyrighted.
Since version 1.3, PMB keeps track of source of bibliographical records.
The administrative function for sources of records allows to pre-define these sources. It also allows the editing of sources of imported records.

sect1.title: Status
sect1.para: The status of records allows to set distinct properties to records at processing and cataloguing levels, and whether they are to be displayed in OPAC as well.
The records status table shows various information:

listitem.para: a display class (1 to 9), corresponds to a color rectangle on the left of the table. This marker quickly identifies the status of the record, for example, when using the cataloguing tab for a search.
whether visible or not from the PMB management tab. This will allow the management of a "reservoir of records", for example, by saving destroyed records with a "destroy" status.

sect1.para: To add a new status to a record, click on the appropriate button at the bottom of the screen.
To edit the status of a record, click on the corresponding line in the table,

From the edit screen, you can also restrict the display of records, copies, e-copies to subscribers only (readers and borrowers with a login and password). If restrictions apply, the reader will have to be identified in order to remove these restrictions.

sect1.title: Customizable data
sect1.para: Here we are talking of customizable fields of records. These customizable fields allow you to specify any information about your own library or documentation center within the records: origin of idea to acquire the work, commentary of a reading committee, intended audience...
Customizable fields for records work the same way as those for copies. For more information, refer to .
